meanings.definition: The quality or state of being musical.
meanings.sent1: Her musicalities shone through in every note she sang.
meanings.sent2: The musicalities of the symphony orchestra delighted the audience.
meanings.sent3: His musicalities were so evident that even the birds stopped to listen.
meanings.sent4: The musicalities of nature's symphony played harmoniously in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The musicalities of the piano echoed beautifully in the concert hall.

meanings.definition: The musical elements or characteristics of something.
meanings.sent1: The musicalities of the song were captivating and melodic.
meanings.sent2: She analyzed the musicalities of the composition with great interest.
meanings.sent3: The musicalities of the cake's ingredients blended perfectly in taste.
meanings.sent4: His speech had the musicalities of a well-composed sonata.
meanings.sent5: The musicalities of the dance routine were graceful and rhythmic.

meanings.definition: The ability to produce or appreciate music.
meanings.sent1: His musicalities allowed him to play multiple instruments with ease.
meanings.sent2: She had a deep appreciation for the musicalities of different genres.
meanings.sent3: The cat's musicalities were evident as it purred along to the tune.
meanings.sent4: Her heart resonated with the musicalities of the opera singer's voice.
meanings.sent5: The child's musicalities blossomed as they learned to play the guitar.
